content: of the circle ○ a magic_ring is one that you can tighten so it doesn t leave a hole you can find various descriptions of how to do this on the internet basically you form a loop of yarn over your fingers leaving a tail in any way you find comfortable then work the stitches into that loop pull the tail to tighten the loop and darn in the end rings spirals and row round squiggles are worked in spirals or rings you can choose which you prefer spirals are easier though may not give you quite such a smooth centre they also mean you can just keep going until you want to stop rings are joined with a slip-stitch and do enable you to see each time you have been right round the shape strip squiggles are worked in row turning at the end of each row 1 my squiggles are colour coded uk double_crochet us single_crochet ○ orange edging - increase in every stitch ○ pink edging - increase in alternate stitches ○ green edging - increase in every 3rd stitch uk treble_crochet us double_crochet ○ blue edging - increase in every stitch not shown in this photo increase in every stitch orange ○ small - 8 rounds ○ large - 9 rounds ○ small strip - 5 row ○ large strip - 7 row increase in alternate stitches pink ○ centre - 8 rounds ○ 13 rounds increase in every third stitch green ○ centre - 10 rounds ○ 16 rounds 2 the photos show the number of rounds or row i worked but you can make as many as you want the squiggles become more tightly packed as you add more the round orange squiggle became quite difficult to work by the time it reached the ninth round the same thing would eventually happen to all the others it just takes longer to reach that point when the increases are more spaced out and the work can start to get quite heavy in each case my final round was in a contrast colour this isn t necessary but if you do want to add the contrast you need to think about it before your squiggle gets too tight to add any more to make a tidy join between the main colour and the contrast end the main colour with a few slip stitches then join the new colour on a different part of the circle there are more stitches than you might imagine round the edge of a squiggle see tables later don t worry if you make any minor mistakes nobody will ever notice method - round squiggle increasing in every stitch make a ring of 6 stitches in either of the ways described on page 1 work 2 double_crochet into the top of every stitch keep going until you have as much as you want work a few slip stitches to taper the end and fasten_off method - strip squiggle increasing in every stitch
